alert.note: Alert for Vernon (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 22 at 8:24AM CDT until March 24 at 11:00AM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Springfield MO has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Missouri... Little Osage River near Horton affecting Vernon County. .Recent rains will push the Little Osage River near Horton to just above flood stage. For the Little Osage River Basin...including Horton, Fulton...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO LATE THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Little Osage River near Horton. * WHEN...From this afternoon to late Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...At 41.0 feet, minor flooding affects low lying areas near the gage site and farmland along the river. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:45 AM CDT Tuesday the stage was 39.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this afternoon to a crest of 41.3 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage late tomorrow morning. - Flood stage is 41.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 41.3 feet on 05/21/2011. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Wednesday morning at 830 AM CDT.
